text.0: o indra hear us raining down the soma we call on thee to win us mighty valour.
text.1: give us strong succour on the day of trial when the tribes gather on the field of battle.
text.2: the warrior son of warrior sire invokes thee to gain great strength that may be won as booty.
text.3: to thee the brave mans lord the fiends subduer he looks when fighting hand to hand for cattle.
text.4: thou didst impel the sage to win the daylight didst ruin Śuṣṇa for the pious kutsa.
text.5: the invulnerable demons head thou clavest when thou wouldst win the praise of atithigva.
text.6: the lofty battlecar thou broughtest forward thou holpest dasadyu the strong when fighting.
text.7: along with vetasu thou slewest tugra and madest tuji strong who praised thee indra.
text.8: thou madest good the laud what time thou rentest a hundred thousand fighting foes o hero.
text.9: slewest the dāsa Śambara of the mountain and with strange aids didst succour divodāsa.
text.10: made glad with somadraughts and faith thou sentest cumuri to his sleep to please dabhīti.
text.11: thou kindly giving raji to pithinas slewest with might at once the sixty thousand.
text.12: may i too with the liberal chiefs o indra acquire thy blin supreme and domination.
text.13: when mightiest herogirt nahuṣa heroes boast them in thee the triplystrong defender.
text.14: so may we he thy friends thy best beloved o indra at this holy invocation.
text.15: best be pratardani illustrious ruler in slaying foemen and in gaining riches.
